lines.text: I'm tired of going to noisy bars and parties and not being able to talk to people. I tried using a Sena SMH10 Bluetooth motorcycle communication system with the SMH-A0303 clamp-on microphones, clamped onto Sony MDR-NC7 noise-canceling headphones. This almost worked. :-)  The problem was a lack of volume in the headphones. Specifically, the other person's voice wasn't loud enough, although the beep indicating that the Sena unit was at maximum volume was very loud, and crackling sounds due to poor connections in one of the Sena units (defective) were very loud.
